cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 110 miles east of Cape Canaveral, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest tonight, then turning north and north-northeast paralleling the southeast U.S. coast, expected to pass very near the Georgia coast Wednesday night before approaching the South Carolina and North Carolina coasts
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the South Carolina coast (Charleston area) or just offshore

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning (also under Storm Surge Warning)
weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Ponte Vedra Beach FL to Savannah River
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Ponte Vedra Beach FL to Savannah River (TS Wng); Jupiter Inlet FL to Surf City NC (Storm Surge Wng)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coastline from east-central Florida through Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (80%) of tropical-storm-force winds; 30% chance of 50-kt winds; hurricane-force winds (64-kt) remain low (~3%) but cannot be ruled out if the center hugs the coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 4–7 ft possible Wednesday night into Thursday along the Georgia coast including the Savannah River entrance.
weather_observation.rainfall: Forecast 3–6 inches with locally higher amounts, capable of producing flash flooding around the port area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, rip currents, and a low tornado risk in outer rain bands on Wednesday.
